body_html: When we were working on the new CI, Pietern mentioned that if you use pytest, you can get machine readable test output and have Jenkins display it, which would solve the "failed test rendering problem." I looked at doing this very briefly, but the problem is that run_test.sh dispatches some tests multiple times with different environment variables MULTIPROCESSING_METHOD=spawn python test_multiprocessing.py and I am not actually familiar enough pytest to know if achieving this is actually possible.

body: When we were working on the new CI, Pietern mentioned that if you use pytest, you can get machine readable test output and have Jenkins display it, which would solve the "failed test rendering problem." I looked at doing this very briefly, but the problem is that `run_test.sh` dispatches some tests multiple times with different environment variables `MULTIPROCESSING_METHOD=spawn python test_multiprocessing.py` and I am not actually familiar enough pytest to know if achieving this is actually possible.
